alert.note: Alert for Anchorage; East Turnagain Arm; Matanuska Valley; Western Kenai Peninsula (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 15 at 7:18AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...GUSTY WINDS AND WARMING TEMPERATURES TODAY... Snow laden trees and power lines from recent storms combined with winds today may cause limbs to break and bring down trees already leaning from the heavy snow load. Winds will gust as high as 40 to 55 mph along the Anchorage Hillside, Eagle River, and channeled areas like the S Turns of the Glenn Highway. For lower elevations, such as the Anchorage Bowl and the Mat Valley, gusts in the 25 to 35 mph range are expected. Power outages are also possible. Please exercise caution in areas where snow laden trees and limbs could fall, especially as winds increase this morning. Warming temperatures may cause some melting of snow on area roadways, which will refreeze when temperatures drop back below freezing.

area.areaDesc: Anchorage; East Turnagain Arm; Matanuska Valley; Western Kenai Peninsula
